hackathon-description-text: WilHacks is an exciting and interactive experience where high school students will be given the opportunity to demonstrate or develop their programming skills. WilHacks is a free 24 hour event at Adrian C. Wilcox High School with great food, accomodations and access to technology.You and/or your team (up to to individuals per team) will have 24 hours to create an innovative application which will be reviewed by our judges for implementation and creativity. This hackathon is an excellent opportunity for students to showcase their programming skills in a competitive atmosphere as well as have an enjoyable hacking experience. How will you make a difference?

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: -Fire HD 8 Tablets with Alexa, 8" HD Display, 16 GB
-Anker SoundCore Bluetooth Speaker + 3.5mm Premium Auxiliary Audio Cable + SoundCore Official Travel Case
-$150 Amazon Gift Voucher for best hack/website submitted on a .tech domain

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=3250 Monroe St, Santa Clara, CA 95051, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How creative your project will be is a prominent criteria and will be the one that earns a majority of the points.
This criteria is not as important as the judges understand that it is a 24 hour timed project, so points will be given as long as there is some functionality(the more functional, the more points).
How your project is designed and looks will earn points.
The quality of your project will be judged and points will be awarded accordingly.

hackathon-location-address: 3250 Monroe St, Santa Clara, CA 95051, USA
hackathon-description-header: A free 24 hour event in which any high school student can attend and create a computer based application.
